title: Lodestar should only submit `active` and `pending` validators during builder registration

labels.name: prio-high
labels.description: Resolve issues as soon as possible.

labels.name: scope-interop
labels.description: Issues that fix interop issues between Lodestar and CL, EL or tooling.

body:
Hi all! I'm the maintainer of the Rocket Pool Smartnode stack and am updating our Goerli beta with the latest Lodestar in prep for a mainnet release soon. I ran into a bug during testing we saw with most of the other CL clients.

**Describe the bug**

The bug is simple - according to the official [builder API spec](https://ethereum.github.io/builder-specs/#/Builder/registerValidator) you should only send `active` or `pending` validators to the external builder during registration. In other words, you can't send it `slashed` or `exited` validators. Doing so causes the following output in MEV-Boost:

```
rocketpool_mev-boost  | time="2022-11-23T05:15:12Z" level=info msg="http: POST /eth/v1/builder/validators 502" duration=0.161919 method=POST path=/eth/v1/builder/validators status=502 version=v1.4.0

rocketpool_mev-boost  | time="2022-11-23T05:21:36Z" level=warning msg="error calling registerValidator on relay" error="HTTP error response: 400 / {\"code\":400,\"message\":\"failed to verify validator signature for 0x9188c03e733ef2ad8bf778480e0cda1f76eb8166a27e9f12c73ee6ec294f29238b72c01e139a3370afe7ce7ec32b94ef\"}\n{\"code\":400,\"message\":\"not a known validator: 0x95901b2ab0202da7859b1f279fdd0015162e56b5500f2a6614fb9d4c554c8e4099e96ccf32f1a47b568efd55411583a5\"}\n" method=registerValidator numRegistrations=3 ua="node-fetch/1.0 (+https://github.com/bitinn/node-fetch)" url="https://relay-goerli.edennetwork.io/eth/v1/builder/validators?id=rocketpool" version=v1.4.0
```

and a corresponding error message in Lodestar's VC:

```
rocketpool_validator  | Nov-23 05:28:00.225[]                error: Failed to register validator registrations with builder epoch=137170 Bad Gateway: Bad Gateway: no successful relay response
rocketpool_validator  | Error: Bad Gateway: Bad Gateway: no successful relay response
rocketpool_validator  |     at HttpClient.requestWithBody (file:///usr/app/packages/api/src/utils/client/httpClient.ts:258:15)
rocketpool_validator  |     at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)
rocketpool_validator  |     at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
rocketpool_validator  |     at HttpClient.request (file:///usr/app/packages/api/src/utils/client/httpClient.ts:132:12)
rocketpool_validator  |     at Object.request [as registerValidator] (file:///usr/app/packages/api/src/utils/client/client.ts:82:9)
rocketpool_validator  |     at registerValidator (file:///usr/app/packages/validator/src/services/prepareBeaconProposer.ts:110:11)
rocketpool_validator  |     at Clock.runAtMostEvery (file:///usr/app/packages/validator/src/util/clock.ts:96:7)
``` 

The example validator in question here is [0x95901b2ab0202da7859b1f279fdd0015162e56b5500f2a6614fb9d4c554c8e4099e96ccf32f1a47b568efd55411583a5](https://prater.beaconcha.in/validator/0x95901b2ab0202da7859b1f279fdd0015162e56b5500f2a6614fb9d4c554c8e4099e96ccf32f1a47b568efd55411583a5#attestations), which voluntarily exited long ago.

As I mentioned, most of the other CL clients had the same problem. We [created an issue](https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/issues/245) on Flashbots' mev-boost repo to track it. Lighthouse, Nimbus, Prysm, and Teku have resolved it - links to each of their own issues is provided in the above.

**Expected behavior**

Lodestar should only register validators that are in one of the following states:
```
- pending_initialized
- pending_queued
- active_ongoing
- active_exiting
- active_slashed
```

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Make a validator
2. Voluntarily exit it
3. Observe the above behavior

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Any
- Version: v1.2.1 via the Docker container
- Branch: ---
- Commit hash: ---
